intro: Carapa moluccensis var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf campeche, is a tropical tree native to the islands of the Indonesian archipelago. It is characterized by its elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Its bark is valued for its high content of fatty acids, making it useful in traditional medicine and industrial applications. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soils.
